title: Joker star Joaquin Phoenix 'scratches' bumper on fire department truck
text:
Joaquin Phoenix, pictured her at Venice International Film Festival in August, bumped into a fire truck and tracked down the paramedics to confess to them

Joaquin Phoenix crashed into a Los Angeles County Fire Department truck on Tuesday night in his Tesla but tracked down the officers immediately so that he could confess.

Phoenix searched for the paramedics who had been using the truck and found them to explain what had happened.

He told them that he misjudged the turning out of the parking lot in West Hollywood and didn't leave enough room. He scraped the bumper of the empty vehicle.

When he found the paramedics they called the police and exchanged insurance information. They took damage reports because LA County property was involved in the incident.

Witnesses at the scene said that Joaquin came off worse in the collision with damage to the right front quarter panel of his Tesla Model-S.

Police said the star of the Joker was a pleasure to deal with and behaved cordially.

Phoenix was driving the Tesla Model S - a full-sized electric plug in five-door sedan with rear-mounted electric motor Tesla cars as he turned round the corner in West Hollywood. He told the officers that he misjudged the turn

The star of the Joker, met with fans last week at a cinema screening of the new box office smash. Police who attended the scene said the actor was a pleasure to deal with

Last week, Joaquin delighted fans when he attended a screening of the Joker at the Alamo Drafthouse in LA. He interacted with fans, took videos and selfies with them and walked them through various scenes.

The film has caused controversy due to its representation of mental health and violence since it opened across the world last week.

The film has attracted smashed box office expectation earning it the 'largest October domestic opening ever' and $93.5 million in ticket sales.
